Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 07:31AM Drcarb11 wrote: Thanks for the quick reply. What concerns me is the surgeon took tissue out from DIFFERENT areas than where the lump was? Why would he do this if he says it did not look very suspicious to him?

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 04:20PM Drcarb11 wrote: Leaf,  did you ever found out why the surgeon did this? Is this the usual thing they are doing? I am sooo worried he saw something else and did not tell me  Silke
Posts.Title: After excisional biopsy Drcarb11 leaf

Posts.Content: Drcarb11 wrote: I had an excisional biopsy wednesday. When the surgeon came out to speak to my girlfriend he told her that it did not look very suspicious but he took additional tissue ou from different areas beside the lump i had. Why would he do this? I did not speak with him after the surgery but I have a follow up on tuesday, hopefully with the results, the waiting is crazy. My mother was diagnosed when she was 46 and died on BC with age 55.I am a wreck. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: After excisional biopsy Drcarb11 leaf

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 07:37AM Drcarb11 wrote: My imagings didn't show anything but extremely dense breast tissue, Diagnostic Mammo and ultrasound did not detect the palpable lump at all. When surgeon felt the lump he felt something else in a different area but assured me it was just lumpy and he did not mentioned anything about taking more tissue out of that area.
Posts.Title: After excisional biopsy Drcarb11 leaf

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2008 08:06PM Drcarb11 wrote: Hi, I had a lump which was not detected by mammo and ultrasound. I had an excisional biopsy wednesday and still waiting for the results. It is possible, be glad your doctor is doing a biopsy, I went through 3 different doctors who all told me to wait 1 year, which I felt not comfertable with.I finally found a great breast surgeon and I am hoping for good news.
